intro: Matelea biflora, commonly known as the two-flowered matelea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Matelea biflora is also known for its medicinal properties, with some traditional uses in folk remedies.
